questions.question_text: An engineer is performing an international multisite deployment and wants to create an effective backup method to access TEHO destinations in case there is a call failure through the primary route. Which technology provides this ability?

discussion.content: CORRECT ANSWER:B , in case of bandwidth issue the answer would be C

choices.A: The dial plan is simplified with local route groups.
choices.C: Toll charges can be reduced when TEHO is implemented with CAC.
choices.B: Local route groups add complexity to the dial plan.
choices.D: Toll charges can be reduced when TEHO is implemented with MGCP fallback.

questions.question_text: Which statement about TEHO is true?

discussion.content:
Call Services CallsToUnknownIPAddresses: <Off/Direct/Indirect>
Determines the way in which the VCS will attempt to call systems which are not registered with it or one of its
neighbors.
Direct: allows an endpoint to make a call to an unknown IP address without the VCS querying any
neighbors. The call setup would occur just as it would if the far end were registered directly to the local
system.
Call Routed Mode: <Always/Optimal>
Specifies whether the VCS routes the signaling for calls.
Always: the VCS will always route the call signaling.

choices.A: Endpoints can make calls to unknown IP addresses without the VCS querying any neighbors.
choices.C: Endpoints that are registered directly to the VCS can call only an IP address of a system that is also registered directly to that VCS.
choices.D: Dialing by IP address is not supported on VCS.
choices.B: If the VCS receives a call to an unknown IP address, it queries its neighbors for the remote address and if permitted, it routes the call through the neighbor.

discussion.content:
To enable the quality of service (QoS) functionality globally, use the mls qos
mls qos map cos-dscp:the CoS-to-DSCP map. CoS values 0 to 7 are mapped to DSCP values
If you enter the mls qos trust cos command, the default CoS-to-DSCP map is applied

questions.question_text: Which three commands are necessary to override the default CoS to DSCP mapping on interface Fastethernet0/1? (Choose three.)

choices.D: interface Fastethernet0/1 mls qos trust cos

discussion.content: Could be D, if you disable this setting on the phone it will ignore the Cluster settings

choices.A: all phones in the cluster that support device mobility
choices.B: all phones in the cluster that subscribed to device mobility
choices.C: mobile phones in the cluster that support device mobility
choices.D: mobile phones in the cluster that are in default mode

questions.question_text: When device mobility mode is enabled or disabled for a cluster, to which does the cluster setting apply?
